This place is fantastic. The area it's located is so quaint. Victorian houses everywhere. I work uptown, so I walked to the restaurant because it was only five minutes away (walking distance.) Our server was amazing, I forgot her name, but she was great. When I looked at the food pics on yelp, I noticed the catfish sandwich and was looking for it on the menu, however, it wasn't there. So I asked the server and she said it's usually only on Fridays, but can ask if they can make it for me, which they were able to so that made me excited. We ordered that and the Black Quinoa burger and told the server we are going to split both of them. When she brings the food to us, she had them cut each sandwich in half and give us separate plates for each sandwich with the sides. BEST SERVICE EVER.  Both sandwiches were absolutely delicious and the Cajun fries were great. I highly recommend this place and will definitely go back. Thank you for a great first experience!

Loooonnnng overdue review of this neighborhood icon.  We're lucky enough to live a block from Al Mike's and love everything about this little neighborhood gem.  The quality is reliable and on point, and you can't beat the genuine corner pub vibe.  You can't replicate that authenticity with a chain joint or strip mall bar/restaurant.  Al Mike's is the real deal and should be on everyone's gastro bucket list, whether you live here, or are just visiting.  One of the best!

We first stopped in here on a whim, on the way home from an event. We like to try new places and we were very pleasantly surprised by this gem. It's got a great ambience, a delicious menu and great staff. If there is a downside to the place, it's that there can be really long waits for dinner. Also, parking can be a challenge, but that' sang issue for the entire 4th ward. Other than that, they have a great selection of beers, and a delicious and varied menu. I highly recommend Alexander Michaels...

One of my favorite places to eat in Uptown. My go to dishes are the London broil entree and the what it is. Tried out most of the menu and can't say I've had anything bad. The daily specials are usually pretty great as well.

I'm going to be the odd person and not give this place a glowing review.

First off, the atmosphere is actually cool.  This is a true pub.  Beautiful dark wood is everywhere.  The staff is also very nice, no complaint there.

The thing is, I don't really have a complaint, I'm just not impressed with the food.  I find it acceptable, but nothing special.  In fact, the menu is, to me, kinda boring.  I think the point of this place is more to go "have a few" after work and such.  When looking for great food in uptown, this place wouldn't make my list.  I do love that it's locally owned and operated, however, and harbor no ill feelings.

What a cute little restaurant. Alexander Michaels, also know to locals as Al Mikes, has so much charm! It's tucked back in 4th ward and appears to fit right within the neighborhood- it looks like a quaint house from the outside. And from what I've heard, it use to be an old grocery store! The decor is old school- wood paneling, throwback signs, but the food is delicious! 


IMO, AL's has one of the best veggie burgers in Charlotte! This is a must try item, even if you're a meat lover. The veggie burger isn't served on a bun, but rather than pita bread. It's a quinoa bean burger and it's just fricken delicious, especially because it's topped with avocado!   

Another must try are their fried pickles with ranch. I mean is there anything to question with this recommendation? NO. Order them- love them- and come back again!

Good food and good service, plain and simple. 

I came here alone one night for dinner, and as a solo diner, I really just want something tasty that won't take forever. This place was perfect. It's got an atmospheric dimly candle-lit tavern setting, no unrealistically chipper smiles, no needless conversation. Just efficient servers who get you what you need. I loved it!

As for the food, I ordered the Cajun catfish sandwich and a cup of soup. The sandwich came with a remoulade which was good, but also with a tangy pickle jammy type sauce that I thought really pulled the dish together. I had a cup of crab soup as well- it was rich and hearty. 

I left here satisfied, and was impressed even more by the value. I'll definitely be back!

All I can say is honey chicken.  One of the best pasta dishes I have ever had.  I'm not from Charlotte, but make it a point to eat it everytime I visit.  Locals living near the restaraunt know it by name.  I've heard the other food is also great, but I can't get off the honey chicken.  The staff was extremely friendly.

Visited this place last week, and was fairly disappointed. Very small seating area, and the food was mediocre. I had their Greek salad and spicy crab soup. The crab in the soup was clearly imitation. HUGE DISAPPOINTMENT. Only positive about this place is that it's fairly affordable during lunch hours. Don't plan on ever going back!
My favorite restaurant in Charlotte.  The "What it is" pasta dish is phenomenal.

Every time i have lunch at Alexander Michaels it is wonderful. I recommend this hidden gem to my coworkers in the music factory. I highly recommend you stop in for a meal and ice cold beer. Parking can be a little tough

Outstanding place for great food and lovely pub atmosphere...first time there this past Friday and I could have just stopped with the crab soup.  DELICIOUS!  Great prices and just a wonderful experience before a concert at The Underground. We will definitely be back!

By far my favorite place in Charlotte. The atmosphere and service are outstanding. Al Mike's is my first recommendation anytime someone asks where to eat. My only request.. Bring back Octoberfeast! Fried pickles are the best in town!

We really liked the pub feel of this place and the location hidden among the houses. It could be easy to miss if you didn't know it was there. The inside didn't feel like a house at all, it was pretty dark inside, yet light enough to read the menu and socialize. The service was great, prompt refills, although we did wait an extended period of time to get our check. 
i had the buffalo chicken sandwich and Cajun fries. Wasn't a big fan of the buffalo chicken. i guess i prefer more sauce and flavor. It seemed like too much chicken and bun, with not enough flavor. i liked the Cajun fries for my side and they were a generously sized portion.

We also tried the nachos. My special lady friend gave them a thumbs up. They were flour tortilla chips which seemed odd at first, but in the end seemed like a good choice. 

i'd like to go back another time when i can enjoy some drinks and try another menu selection.

Good food. The Cajun fries were great and the Caribbean jerk quesadilla was awesome. I got the buffalo chicken sandwich and it was just okay... Was not very spicy and I wish it had cheese on it. They didn't have enough menus for everyone but the service was great and the atmosphere was nice. Great food my friends loved the Ruben I just didn't make the best pick.

Came here today after a recommendation at the hotel I was staying. I must have come on an off day. The spicy crab soup was just ok, warm, not hot. Fried chicken with gravy and mashed potatoes was pretty good, but they had run out of mashed potatoes and so they gave me garlic mashed which didn't taste right with the chicken and gravy on top. Service was average at best...and my waitress was almost mean. Perhaps this place is just for locals.

Hate to ditto what others have said, but it's true, the service was absolutely amazing for a Friday evening dinner out. They don't do reservations, but that lets them show their attentiveness, wish places that do take reservations were as efficient and thoughtful. The atmosphere is very cozy and charming. The only drawback is parking can be a challenge, so you may need to walk, but I got lucky and was able to park almost out front, so you may get lucky too! The big tip I'd give is the crab soup, that stuff is like liquid gold, really good.

I really enjoyed this restaurant. It was inviting, and the food was good. We had the nacho appetizer which was big enough for both of us. The black beans with all the salad yummies could have been a meal in itself. No room for dessert!

I wish the GPS had been right about the derelict building it had initially brought me to....I would have been happily on my way to a satisfying meal elsewhere.....perhaps a place that doesn't have two legal parking places in a 5 block radius ....one of which is occupied by the restaurants mascot. An old beat up pick up truck....which seems to have avoided citation for 20 years. 

 When this gem was recommended to me as a fantastic "seasonal" restaurant, I wanted to call them immediately and ask them what season we were in that served these nasty, cold, ..
Oh but "smoked"quesadillas .  or perhaps when a good time of the year it was to enjoy this warm on the outside...cold on the inside tuna melt.  The waitress seemed shocked that one could possibly eat it any other way.   

 About 2/3 through the meal, we were asked to settle up...because at that time of day... Something with their computers demanded them to stop all service... And start a new tab.

 

 Nothing special on this menu.... Overrated pub grub.
This is by far one of my favorite places in Charlotte.  It has a very chill atmosphere and the food is great.  This is a great first date spot.

Neat place in the historic area of downtown Charlotte.  Walkable to all the tall buildings but feels like you are in a neighborhood.  Looks like an old-fashioned store with a tin roof.

More of a pub than anything.  Don't look to be knocked out by the food.  But it's good.  Had a half turkey sandwich with gumbo for lunch.

The bar is really cool though.  Good selection of beers including two highland beers from Asheville and other craft beers. I'll be back.

A great neighborhood restaurant/ bar. Off the beaten path in 4th Ward. Food is always consistently very good. Service is excellent. Despite disclaimers on their website about not taking reservations, I've never had to wait.

Atmosphere was good, service was good, menu was limited, BUT the Cheese Cake was incredible, the desert is what pushed my review to 4 stars.

However, the "What it's All About" chicken was very good.  I was disappointed I couldn't substitute for the potatoes, bummer.

I had a great experience at Al Mikes. Loved the location. Tucked away in the beautiful 4th Ward neighborhood. The restaurant was quaint and lovely. The bartender Paul was very nice and helpful. I ordered the stroganoff and it was awesome. Best meal I've had in a while. Will definitely be back soon.

Went early on a Saturday night after a matinee at Belk Theater. Found a parking spot on the street very close to the restaurant. I imagine this doesn't happen as easily during normal dinner time. The restaurant is in a residential neighborhood. After a short wait we were seated. The historic building gives the vibe of a friendly, cozy neighborhood bar. We had the specials and shared them between the two of us:  Bruschetta salad w chicken and Shrimp Alfredo pasta. Both were delicious. The longer we were there the busier it got and the service slowed considerably. I noticed when we arrived and when we left there were open tables, but lots of people waiting to be seated. It took forever to get our bill, so maybe that's where things break down in turning tables. Good food, friendly but slow service.

My family and I were in Charlotte, North Carolina and decided to stop here because of Yelp. As it turns out this was the best restaurant wr have been to in a while. Quality food, large portions, relatively fast seating, and great service.

This is a wonderful little spot. A true hidden treasure! So much history in 4th ward and this restaurant just adds to it. The food is delicious and comes out super quick. I would recommend this place to anyone!! We will surely be back. The service is great too!!!
For sure one needs to order the potato appetizer food just served beef stroganoff and blackened chicken

Top five favorite places in Charlotte. I got the potato wedges to start. The potato is big enough for a group of people and it's very filling. For my entree, I got the "what it is". I am not a fan of cream sauce, but their Cajun cream sauce is so good. The blackened chicken is a great compliment. They have a solid list of local beers on tap as well.
Quaint, atmosphere and great food to boot. If you want to break from the norm, start here!

It's always great to find a place that seems that it just stopped in time and the rest of the world moved on. Alexander and Michaels is one of those places. It's in the middle of a beautiful Victorian Era neighborhood in  what used to be a general store. The inside gives the same impression, with its dark aged wood all around and old decor. The staff was very helpful and friendly from the minute we walked in the door. There's is a good selection of beers on tap but I was happy to see that they had Franziskaner, a classic hefeweizen, perfect to quench my thirst from the scorching heat that day. Had the London broil and Cajun fries for dinner. The cut is from flank steak so it can be a bit tough but the seasoning and flavors made up for the extra chewing. The Cajun fries were the right choice to compliment the meat, not too salty or spicy. In conclusion, it was a good experience and will be back again.

One of my favorite places in Charlotte. Super cozy inside, food is something like mom would make. Great selection of local beers. 

Fried pickles from here are a must! 

Service is alway friendly, go there a few times and they will know you by name. 

If you haven't tried it yet, this Charlotte landmark is a must!
Perfect neighborhood spot. Solid food - pasta and sandwiches. Diverse menu. Highly recommend if in the area.

Cute little spot. I live just a few blocks down the street and have never even passed this place- "hidden gem" seems to be the term of choice for Alexander Michael's. Not only am I in love with the little parks and the historic Fourth Ward homes, but I really adore places with character- and Alexander Michael's has just that.

Alexander Michael's is dimly lit, very old and bar-looking. We were seated right away but the restaurant soon had a big wait at the door. I can see this is a neighborhood favorite. I'm currently in the "I dine out too much and cook huge portions / eat as much as I feed my boyfriend" stage, so I opted against an appetizer and went straight for the blackened catfish. He got the crawfish burrito, which is funny because we noticed that we see cajun/creole EVERYWHERE since our recent New Orleans trip. I swear, I didn't notice anything cajun or creole before NOLA, which is a shame because I adore it so much. Anyway, I tried the burrito (yum) and enjoyed my catfish with sauted vegetables. I'm being healthyish, you know. I'm sure we'll take a stroll back soon.

I'm with one reviewer from a few days ago. 4 1/2 stars, I don't think so.

Great location and good vibe. Interior was very cool.

Waitress and service was good.

Decent local beer selection on tap.

Crab soup was good but we only had a sample as we ordered fried pickled. That was a mistake as the pickles were nothing special.

Daughter had only fries which were below average.

Wife had meatloaf special which was only ok.

I had blackened catfish sandwich. Came on a bun that was 3 dense inches thick. I only ate the top and that was more than enough. 
  
Other than the location and atmosphere I would not go out of my way for the food.

Cool, cozy spot in the 4th ward. Parking was a little difficult but their website gives enough info on where to park and where not to park. Very sex dimly lit bar, great for casual dates. Food was wholesome and filling though not extremely exciting. That's okay in my mind since it is a neighborhood restaurant that is really there to keep its community full, not rob their wallets. I'd go again for a beer and a burger.

I absolutely adore this place. I feel like it is a hidden gem to most. This was the first place I ate out at when I moved to Charlotte about 3 years ago and is now a favorite date night for my boyfriend and I. Especially for dinner in the Fall, because it is the perfect season for their spicy crab soup - YUM. I usually go for either a pasta dish or a salad and have loved everything I have ordered here. Last time I got the cajun chicken pasta, delish! Such a great atmosphere hidden in uptown.

This is a very cute neighborhood joint but the food left a lot to be desired, especially given the price.

I ordered the chicken marsala, and while the serving size was huge, the pasta itself wasn't very good. It was under-seasoned and didn't really have that marsala taste, it mostly tasted like cream and cheese. The chicken was also overcooked. 

However, my SO had the What Is It pasta, which he loved. So it seems the dishes are hit or miss here.

I love Al Mike's. The restaurant is hidden in the beautiful First Ward neighborhood. They've got great food, a good beer list and a very chill atmosphere. I typically get the blue cheese burger, while my boyfriend loves to get the London broil sandwich or the pita chicken wrap with honey mustard. The fries and onion rings are delicious too. Plus, it's non-smoking, which I LOVE. I just wish it stayed open later.

I've been meaning to write a review for a while because there is a lot to say about this place. First off, this is not your typical restaurant or "watering hole" which is what I love! Tucked away in 4th ward you may unfortunately overlook this hidden gem. It is a historic home turned into a lovely and quaint restaurant. The ambiance is something you will not find in other uptown Charlotte restaurants. The food has always been top notch, along with the service. I've dined (and drank at the bar) many times and everytime I leave I know it won't be long before I'll be back :) On a side note...definitely try the "what it is" pasta dish! Truthfully, all of the food I've had has been extremely tasty. They even offer daily food specials that usually aren't on the menu. You definitely can't go wrong by coming to this place!

What a terrific local restaurant, tavern, local brews!  I had the Copper (amber) beer and pasta!  Good food reasonable prices nice ambience!

Special thanks to Kaylor, the bartender for her hospitality!

This historic neighborhood restaurant boast a great atmosphere - large windows in the front of the joint let in a lot of natural light during the day and a bar with tv's that stretch along the length of the restaurant. It's a great spot to grab a drink with some friends and have a few appetizers. At night the restaurant is darker - due to the dark wood interiors and dinner light. It's cozy feeling. 

I've been twice now, however, and both times I felt let down by the food. The food was mediocre. I had a chicken dish the first time and the second time a quesadilla because quite frankly I couldn't find anything else on the menu that was speaking to me. Maybe I ordered wrong both times?

If you are in the mood for bar food (appetizers), drinks and a great atmosphere -- come here. It will meet your needs and you will not be disappointed. 

I'm sure we'll make it back here at some point - at that time I'll have to edit my review - hopefully I just ordered wrong!

Tucked away in a hundred year old building that was originally a General Store in the quaint 4th Ward neighborhood, this is what I call a destination restaurant.  You definitely would never just stumble upon it.  It was opened in 1983 by two Charlotte attorneys (A. Michael Troiano Jr & Alexander Copeland III), hence the name Alexander Michael's.  Great beer selection, friendly staff, fried pickles, tavern atmosphere.  WHAT IT IS and the BEEF STROGANOFF don't suck.  Dark, cozy and just a fun place to hang out!

I've only ate here one time at lunch and quite enjoyed it.  This is one of those places that you'd never find unless one, you find it on the infamous Yelp!, or two, someone took you here because they knew about it --mine was the latter.  The location is buried in a residential area of uptown Charlotte right off the beaten track --which really gives it a unique feel.

The insides kind of had the feeling of a snug, English style pub.  It was quite small and the tables were pushed relatively close together.  Its overall appearance was pretty clean despite its dark look and feel.

The food was pretty good.  I got their club sandwich with fries and my kids got the grilled cheese --which looked and tasted great!  The club sandwich was alright, using just regular deli meat and cheese on thick toasted bread.

The staff at this place were great.  They were very friendly and polite and pretty efficient, too.  The only downside to this place was I thought it was pretty expensive for what you got.

I'm so tired of chains & the restaurants that have no uniqueness.  My family went for lunch at this gem this Afternoon and were happily surprised.  Feels like an old historic home where you are greeted right away with friendly servers.  Everyone enjoyed their dishes from a three cheese grilled cheese on texas toast to tuna melts to a quiona veggie burger.  Service, food and atmosphere made an enjoyable afternoon!

The spicy crab soup and the chicken leek  soup were delicious and I suspect homemade. The Ruben washed down with the Mecktoberfest beer was a good combo.  Very good lunch and would come back to try the dinner menu.

We had one night to go out to dinner during our recent Charlotte visit, and Al Mike's is where my friend wanted to take us.  Of course, I had to look up the reviews on Yelp before I agreed, and once I did, I was sold.  

And now that I've been, I must say, Charlotte Yelpers, you are right on with this one!

I love this incredibly charming historic restaurant and the 4th Ward neighborhood that surrounds it.  AM's atmosphere is warm and inviting.  Luckily, we arrived early on Saturday night (around 6:30), so we didn't have to wait for a table... (The restaurant did, however, fill up within a half hour).

The highlights in my eyes:
*great beer selection!
*fried pickles! 
*burger
*onion rings

It was my first time ever trying fried pickles, and I'm a fan!  We devoured them as an appetizer for the table.  

We weren't huge fans of the crab soup, and I'd stay away from salads... they are nothing special.

The service was attentive with a snap of attitude.  I think they probably are friendlier toward their regulars, but that's fine by me.  If I lived in the area, I'd be a regular too!

Alexander Michael's oozes charm. A charm that you can't find in most Charlotte pubs and restaurants. If this place were dropped in the middle of London, it would fit right in -- although the menu would need some tweaks. I was with a group of four so we split a number of dishes and I got to taste the chicken wings, spicy crab soup, burger and blackened catfish. The wings were fine, nothing to rave about, the spicy crab soup wasn't spicy and needed a few extra dashes of sherry, the burger was solid and delicious, and the blackened catfish would make any southern fisherman happy. Not surprisingly they have a solid beer menu and the staff was attentive and friendly despite the huge crowds. If I'm ever back in this area, I'll be sure to drop by for a drink or quick snack.

Big fan of Al Mike's. Great, friendly staff and great, cozy atmosphere. There's often neighborhood locals at the bar that are happy to talk to you. We actually started a conversation with a girl sitting at the bar that ended up joining us for dinner. 

We were there on a Monday night and the special was meatloaf. I'm not overly fond of meatloaf, and would usually not order it in a restaurant, but for whatever reason decided to go for it. I'm glad I did as it was amazing. 

I had a slice of carrot cake for desert that was also very good. All in all, it was a great meal with friends. It's worth mentioning again how friendly and helpful the staff was, which genuinely helps to make the Alexander Michael's experience. Al Mike's is what a neighborhood pub should be.

A Mikes, wow! After being a little unimpressed with my choice of poplar for pre dinner drinks, my hubs was pleasantly surprised by the laid back vibes in A Mikes. Our server was sweet and engaging. We ordered drinks and wings for appetizer. They were very tasty and smoking hot! Hubs ordered a pasta dish with chicken and bacon which he loved and I ordered the London broil with Cajun fries and it was amazing! Well done A Mikes, we will be back!

When you first walk in you immediately feel like your in an old world tavern and eveyone in town is there.  Despite the number of people, Susie still managed to deliver great service.  The catfish was perfect and full of flavor.  I also highly recommend the spicy crab soup.  I'm so glad I found this place.

In Charlotte for a business trip and found this gem thanks to Yelp. And after a wonderful first visit, I found it a few more times that week. A bit of a divey atmosphere in a great little historic neighborhood. Food is phenomenal, I got the daily special each time just to have some variety. I wasn't disappointed any time I was there, and neither was anyone else we were with. The place gets pretty crowded around lunch so I recommend staying away right at noon - aim for 11:30 or after 1.

Great spot in an unexpected neighborhood. I agree with the other reviews - wish my neighborhood bars were like just this one. The bisque was great, and service was attentive (even with the place being super-busy). Definitely a return candidate!
Cool and busy restaurant. A locals favorite; a true neighborhood gathering place / pub. Beautiful building. Good drinks selection. Good food. Fast and friendly service.

This was bar food heaven. Looks like a regular neighborhood bar on the outside and inside. We stopped by around 9 and there was about a 20 minute wait for a table. The places looks like it only fits about 75 people max. 

Waiting for a table we sat at the bar and I noticed they had a great beer selection on tap and I'm not talking Anhueser Busch B.S. Lots of craft beers and a good amount of local brews. I tried a few high ABV brews that were really good and put my head in another world. I had been in town for about 3 hours by this time I'm really liking Charlotte. For dinner I tried something called "What It Is". it's a Cajun pasta dish. Being Cajun, I was hesitant to try cajun food so far away from the deep south but they came though. I considered licking the plate. I was actually sopping up the sauce with bread like I usually only do at home. I was thoroughly impressed.
Cool place. Sort of hard to find.  The food was good and the ambiance was what really drew us in.  Easy access to music city.  We had a quick dinner before a show.

Just got back from there. Busy for a Monday night, speaks to the great food and good service! The crab soup was sensational, best ever. Meatloaf was excellent as was chicken broccoli casserole, both were the specials tonight. Good selection of beers, I don;t care about wine! Plenty of local craft beers. Great service. Noisy and packed by the time we left, deservedly full of people, this place is a gem. Eat here.

This was our first visit to Alexander Mike's but picked it based of previous reviews =) and because it is not far from the Fillmore music venue. When we arrived, at about 5:30, it was still very quiet but began filling up fast (including other tables obviously going to the Carbon Leaf/Big Head Todd and the Monsters concert.) As soon as we walked in a server approached and guided us to a booth. 

Food: We started with the Crab meat Supreme Quesadilla app ($7.60). My girlfriend had the 4th Ward Stroganoff ($13.75) and I had the Feta Chicken ($13.95) as entrees. For drinks, she had a Duvel and I had a Hefeweizen and Oktoberfest on tap. 

As for the starter, I was not very impressed with the quesadilla. The menu advertises it has pepper jack cheese but I detected no pepper jack, just regular monterrey jack cheese. Also, I personally got two bites of crab meat (my girlfiend had several). Given the very mild flavors of crab and monterrey jack, this was a very bland quesadilla. Granted, it did come served with sides of sour cream and salsa and I thought the salsa was pretty good. I just would have preferred the actual quesadilla to stand on its own a bit. 

For the stroganoff, my girlfriend really enjoyed it and would have clean-plated it if she wasn't a carb watcher. I did steal a piece of the beef and thought it was very tasty with the red wine definitely coming through. My Feta chicken was also good (how can you go wrong with Feta?) with extra props going to the sauteed veggies that make up bed along with the penne pasta. They consisted of broccoli, mushrooms, red and green peppers and red onions. I thought they were very well cooked and the white wine/garlic saute was very tasty. The chicken itself was good though a touch overcooked but not enough to ruin the plate. Be advised that, as advertised, it does come sitting in a "broth" so is a wet dish. 

Our meal, including two pre-concert tequila shots ;-) and an appropriate tip, came to about $90 -- not cheap but we did splurge on alcohol a bit. 

Service: Our service was excellent with our waitress obviously very familiar the menu and restaurant. As a plus, as it got busier two owner/manager types stayed available in the dining area helping out and making sure everyone's visit was up to par. 

Atmosphere: This must be one of the big draws as AM is in an old converted house right in the middle of a residential neighborhood. All dark wood with a gorgeous bar, its easy to imagine coming here after work to just hangout for awhile. A couple of HD TV's are present, as well.  It is a fairly tight space, however, so I also imagine there must be times when it is standing room only. 

Food: 7/10; Service: 9/10; Value: 7/10; Atmosphere 10/10

Fantastic date place!!!  This little restaurant has fantastic apps and dinners.  My favorites are the Shrimp Marsala or the What It Is.  The crab soup is excellent also.  When I am there for dinner I always get a half and half with my meal.  But if you are just going for lunch get the chicken quesadillas - excellent.  Ladies!  Watch out for the pole!  Then take a walk around the beautiful Fourth Ward!
lots of character here.  nothing special but just a solid place to grab drinks and good food.  great neighborhood feel.
Enjoyed lunch. The place was packed and the service was very good. Good food. Nice tavern feel.

When I first moved to Charlotte more than a few people mentioned Alexander Michael's to me.  I had my expectations built up.  The place is solid and a decent pub/neighborhood restaurant.  I might have rated it better if people hadn't built it up to me so much before going.  If I lived near the place I would go pretty frequently for a beer or some food.  But I wouldn't go out of my way to get to it (like i would with some other Charlotte places).  All in all - a solid pub/neighborhood bar with some character but nothing earth shattering.

This was my first time at Alexander Michaels and it was a good experience.  I had seen the reviews and a friend recommended a visit.  Glad that I experienced this great place and plan to return.  

In looking at the menu is was all about the open faced turkey sandwich.  Unfortunately they do not offer that with mashed potatoes, WHAT!!!!! that's sac religious.  Not too worry as I had a backup and it was really good.  Had the London Broil sandwich which was really good.  Melt in your mouth goodness.  Probably the best one that I have ever had.   

It is very unassuming from the outside but the vibe is really cool inside.  I really like the dark wood and the way things are layed out.   Service was really good.  We arrived right before the lunch crowd but service was very consistent.  

I want to experience more of the menu and will be back.
A hidden gem in the oldest area of downtown.  An old victorian neighborhood in the midst of downtown Charlotte!  I love the Ruben!
Wonderful atmosphere. Loved the Christmas decorations. Dinner was fabulous. Had the baked chicken special, it was perfect! Parking was a little tricky, but worth it.

We stopped in late night after a Knights game. The place was busy, but not packed. We were seated and greeted promptly. The atmosphere alone makes it a great Saturday date spot. Cozy, intimate and not too loud..dimly lit by candlelight. 

The menu is designed to be a mix of American and Creole..but being from Cajun County, I noticed a real lack of authentic creole cuisine. I was interested in tasting the crawfish burrito, but it was pricy ($16) and I assumed it would be disappointing.  Instead, I opted for a London broil sandwich, which I highly recommend. Extra points for offering Shine Bock on tap..a favorite beer I've missed dearly since Texas, where it's commonly served.

Al Mike's is phenomenal. The atmosphere is incredible. The Spicy She Crab soup is the best thing on the menu. Awesome vibe. You might have to wait a little bit for a table on the weekend but it is so worth it!

This was a hard review as it is a very nice little gem of a restaurant hidden away in the 4th ward of Charlotte. But there were some problems. Like the parking. There is only street parking that at times must be hard to find. Also, a couple of beers I wanted to try, they were out of them. The food was ok but not great. Service was good. Probably would never be a regular place for me to go to in the future.

This is our neighborhood tavern and I love taking out-of-town guests here.  The food is great and has a homestyle quality.  Our favorites are the fried pickles app, Beef Stroganoff and "What it Is" (a nicely spiced chicken in a Cajun cream sauce over Rotini).  It's a feel-good place that definitely notices you when you walk in and remembers you when you come back.  We love the bartenders...nothing like having your favorite drink poured and ready for you AS you settle into your barstool!  And...they carry Gentleman Jack : )

Love Al Mike's! I love the daily specials that almost always include a fantastic salad and just the other day an authentic Cuban sandwich.  The decor is a mix between old school pub and cozy restaurant.  I've been here several times and seem to always get a salad because they normally do their salads with a spinach leaf base, throw in some pasta for good measure and top it off with fantastic grilled chicken.  

It's a little off the beaten path which can be a breath of fresh air from the places to eat lunch or dinner down Tryon Street.  It looks to be built from one of the renovated homes there in the neighborhood with a 'dollhouse' style exterior in my opinion.  Cool character for a restaurant.

One thing to note is that it's a bit dark in there because there isn't any overhead lighting or if there is, it's very minimal.  So if you sit back towards the back prepare to eat by candlelight (even at lunch).  The only windows are towards the front so that's why.

One of my favorite spots I've eaten at in Charlotte. Cozy pub located in a cute local neighborhood, just a few minutes to walk here from Uptown (easier than finding parking in the area).

Ordered the London broil sandwich-it was one of the best steak sandwiches I've ever had. Great quality meat and cheese on a super fresh hoagie roll. The waitress was attentive, always checking in and refilling our drinks. Very casual dress code and laid back atmosphere. Would definitely recommend for lunch or dinner.

Al Mikes is the neighborhood spot. Food is always on point. Some personal favorites are the "What it is" and the "4th Ward Beef Stroganoff" . Both are unique and delish pastas. They have a great bar as well. Because of it's cozy ambiance, Alexander Michael's makes a fab date restaurant.

Stopped in for lunch on a Friday. GREAT service and good food. Had the chicken pita wrap with fries. Nothing too fancy but a great neighborhood bar with a lot of personality. It is located in the historic 4th Ward neighborhood of Charlotte. Walk around before or after your meal and check out the neighborhood, definitely worth it.

This place is amazing. It is a hidden restaurant right in uptown Charlotte. 

The food is amazing. The drinks are amazing, especially the beer selection. It is also a very good place for date night, bro night, or just night. It is so good. :D

 Parking is on the street and it is only for two hours without permit. Just FYI. :D

After moving to Charlotte about a month ago, I have already been to this place about 5 times. I love the atmosphere, the food is always delicious, and they have daily specials that I always look forward to checking out. Local beers, too. Definitely recommend!

Cute little bar tucked away in the 4th ward neighborhood.  Fun atmosphere - and apparently a big pole in the middle of the women's bathroom (see back of menu).  

Had the nachos, fried pickles and the crawfish burrito, all of which were tasty.
Love this place and Paul is THE best! Gets to know you and nothing better than having your drink before you even ask! Great food, friendly service......check it out! Small town feeling in the city
The Spicy crab soup was great. "What It Is" was good with bold flavors. The atmosphere was wonderful, down to earth and friendly. And what topped it off was THE CARROT CAKE!!!!! Superb!!!!!!!!!!

Ok I stumbled over this place by being invited by a friend. I have lived in Charlotte for going on three months and had no idea this place exsisted.  It is tcuked away in a neighborhood right in downtown.  I hear this place is a establishment in Charlotte and has been around for a long time.  I now know why..  the food is fantastic! The fried pickles are a must a littel salty but good.  I had the Fried Chicken Special with Garlic mash with Gravy and it was GOOOOOOOODD!!!  My friend had the London Broil and looked amazing and the prices were so reasonable.  I highly recommend this place its a chance to see a good ol local hangout in the city of Charlotte.

Local brews, great food, love the dessert, and awesome staff/crowd.  I'm happy to have this treasure in my newfound neighborhood.

We ordered potato wedges, crab soup, stroganoff, wings, carrot cake, and crawfish burritos.  All great choices IMO.
One of the best spots in all of Charlotte.  Great for business lunches.  The london broil sandwich is one of the best steak sandwiches I have ever had.  Nice atmosphere and good beer selection too.

This isn't a fine dining, red carpet, gorgeous decor kind of place. But that's fine! This is a very comfortable, relaxing and finally, affordable restaurant. And frankly it is very nicely designed.  I am all about service. Little weak there when we first walked in and based on its size there is no reason not to be properly greeted. Murphy our Waitress was outstanding. Food was outstanding. Prices were totally affordable and worth every penny three people with an app, two drinks per, meals and one dessert amounted to 100 before tip. When done dining be sure to take a walk around that area. Gorgeous! Thank you for a fantastic dining experience!

This place is located in such a great area! Parking can be a little tricky but other than its awesome. The menu and beer selection had a great range and the staff was friendly and make great suggestions. Also my boyfriends family is from Baton Rouge and this place does a great job of incorporating the Cajun flavor in its foods! I will be back!

First of all, I came with an open mind.  Read the other reviews, thought it was a quaint place.  Great place for a couple of drinks and some appetizers.  The food, on the other hand, is NOT good.

Spicy crab soup did not have crab meant in it.  It wasn't even spicy.  Not creamy, more gelatin in consistency.   Please, pass on it.

The London Broil arrived medium well, instead of medium rare.  Figured it was my error at being maybe misunderstood.  No, the waiter was quick to tell me I ordered medium rare.  Took it back and returned with medium rare on the rare side, just the way I like it.  By now, my companions had finished eating.  The meat was so tough, I gave up after a few pieces.  Nothing to write home about.

Parking issue.  There is a parking lot two doors before the restaurant. There is street parking all around if you arrive early enough.  Personally it won't be an issue because I won't be venturing back anytime soon.  

Don't understand the hype. It a neat place. More of the neighborhood bar.  Not a good dinner place.

Al Mike's, as it is locally known, is housed in a 1890's Victorian era building that housed the E.W. Berryhill Store for 70 years. During the 60's & 70's, the building housed multiple businesses, from a paint store, a thrift store, grocery store and delicatessen. In 1983, Michael Alexanders neighborhood tavern opened for business. 

A popular neighborhood institution, Al Mike's retains some interesting building characteristics, such as the supporting pole almost directly in front of the women's restroom door, which lends itself to many a bumped head as well as built in coolers that are original turn of the century ice box coolers. 

We dined on the Spicy Crab Soup, which one of my dining partners characterized as melted Velveeta with crab and while that description might sound rather unappealing, it was quite yummy. In addition to the three cheese on Texas Toast sandwich, which was ok, but a bit on the dry side, my other dining companions had other basics, such as sandwiches and burgers. This is tavern food, so don't go expecting high end meals. The appeal of this restaurant, as a visitor to Charlotte, is that it is located in the Fourth Ward, a small district of brick and Victorian buildings and the unique history of the building that houses Al Mike's.

An old house tucked back in fourth ward. Almost as if you're not even in uptown anymore. The dining space is TIGHT which is part of what makes the dining experience fun. Drinks are great; craft beer and wine menu. Check out the women's bathroom if you're female ;)

Stopped by here for an early lunch. The place wasn't crowded at all so we were immediately seated and got our drinks. The waitress and other employees were very friendly and were always around when we needed something. The food was delicious. I had the Mikes Hot Turkey Sandwich, which was pretty unique, but very flavorful. The turkey was juicy and had great flavor and the gravy was also well made on it. Alexander Michaels is definitely a place I will return to on my trip to Charlotte.

Definitely my favorite "neighborhood-y" type of place in town--and, come to think of it, one of the only restaurants in town that has that sort of feel. Dark, cozy--just a really cool spot. Not far from uptown, but in a more residentially area than you'd expect. It even kinda looks like a house from the road. 

Great bar scene if you're looking to meet up for a few drinks (definitely not the type of place to really meet people or get sloppy, if that's what you're looking to do), with really cool, knowledgeable bartenders. 

Good food, too. Last time in, I had the wings (definitely above average) and a pulled-pork sandwich, which was great. Simple, American-style food but done well, with great ingredients. 

Definitely a great date place. Cool vibe and classy in an understated way--check it out!

If you're looking for a local-to-Charlotte favorite, your search is over. This has been one of my hubby's fav spots since he moved to the Queen City 10 years ago, and now it's one of mine as well. 

You'll walk in and immediately sense the darker, hole-in-the-wall vibe and the close-knit seating arrangement, providing a louder bar-like atmosphere but overall cozy ambience. Our favorite booths are in the back closer to the restrooms, especially the one where you're forced to sit next to your partner/dinner mate. Yes, we are those people. :) 

The fried pickle chips with homemade ranch for dipping are a must-have for every meal at Al Mike's. I branched out from the regular menu options during my last visit and "made my own pasta" with pesto and OH.EM.GEE was it amazing. Took me back to our trip to Italy... seriously. 

Overall, awesome vibe and fun place to bring guests to the Queen City. Highly recommend!!

Alexander Michael's is like an old, trusty friend. No matter how long it is between visits, every time you're reunited, it's like no time has passed at all. We only make it to Al Mike's a few times a year because it's just so tucked into 4th Ward -- parking is tough, there is occasionally a wait, and quite frankly, we forget about it sometimes. When we're in the neighborhood though (usually for the 4th Ward home/garden tours), a visit is a must. 

Service is always laid back yet attentive. They don't mind if you linger but you never go without something you need -- mayo, another napkin, beer refill... The food is solid, too. My favorite appetizer is the potato skins. Their crab soup is to die for. And, I know it sounds weird after I just ticked off apps with bacon and seafood, but their vegetarian quinoa black bean burger is my go-to entree. It has feta cheese and avocado on it. Simply delish!

This is a quiet neighborhood bar with quality food and great service.  This is a good lunch spot and a nice quiet place for dinner and drinks tucked away in Fourth Ward.  Parking can be difficult as it is all on street.  I bring out of town guests here often because it is so different than what most would expect of a city like Charlotte.

I always enjoy their sandwiches and baked chicken.  I used to get grilled cheese and soup as my main order but it wasn't on the menu my last visit.  Their she-crab soup is also very good.  

The drink prices seem very average for the area.

I've had Alexander Michael's bookmarked for a while. I came in during lunch hour with a friend, I was expecting this place to be packed. Luckily, we arrived before the crowd---no wait time. 

The menu is very basic. American cuisine, nothing to scream about. Menu items include Soups, Salads, sandwiches, burgers, and more. I really came for the spicy crab soup which was disappointing in my opinion. Most of the ingredients were great, except the imitation crab (the disappointing part) I picked through it and ate everything else. My friend tasted and confirmed that it was imitation crab. You can taste the sweet flavor---ugh! Now if this was real crab! Ohhhh buddy!! The flavor would've been amazing!! I didn't feel like sending the food back, I wasn't interested in trying anything else. So please excuse my diverse pallet. 

Was the service great? Yes! Our waiter was very nice. Side street parking was easy to find. The restaurant was clean. Will I come back? Probably not.

If it wasn't for the good service and old school cool bar atmosphere, I would've given this place a one star. Food was pretty abysmal, and I'm not sure where the Cajun food was on the menu except some seasoning on the fries. Maybe the dinner menu is better? I was sad we couldn't order the fried pickles at lunch but at least they had three local breweries on tap. The quinoa burger with pasta salad was a let down, not much flavor. In a historic neighborhood that was pleasant to walk through though!
Wow!!! What an amazing place! Jerk Chicken Quesadilla is a must have!!! Good list of local brews. Tracy provided great service....working the bar and the tables! I will be back!!!

My husband and I were sent here a few years ago.  We were looking for a place for date night.  Although loud, it was great.  The story behind the building and its decor was interesting to read.  The food is good.  As most reviewers have stated, it is definitely a hidden gem.  Check it out!
Always love this place! Good food, great atmosphere!! Love the spicy crab soup, not to mention the staff is awesome!!

It's worth the wait on busy nights. They'll never under quote your waiting time like most restaurants will. In my opinion they have the best service in charlotte. 

Their unusual chips they use for the nachos make them very memorable and filling. Very delicious. You can never go wrong with their crab soup or wings either.

Nice food selections, great drinks of course.

Great fourth ward place. My beef here is the lighting is just TOO dark. Cain't see the dang menus or nuthin! But a fine neighborhood bar.

And fried pickles!!!

In the cutest neighborhood in Charlotte, is a great pub style joint perfect for a brew and some excellently prepared food.  It's a rub shoulders kind of joint with dark benches perfect for long conversations.

Tucked in a quaint neighborhood in the 4th ward, Alexander Michaels is a great lunch or dinner spot in Charlotte. I've eaten here a handful of times now and have been impressed each and every time. For starters, I've had the Caribbean Jerk Chicken Quesadillas and the black bean hummus - both are excellent and definitely worth trying. For entrees I've had the Quinoa Black Bean Burger and the Rueben. The veggie burger is one of the best in town (in my humble opinion) and the Rueben is a tasty option as well. 

The service has always been top notch as well. I've never had a bad experience at Alexander Michaels and consider it one of my go-to restaurants when I'm looking for a unique charlotte restaurant that you can't get anywhere else.

Do you remember that scene in Dolly Parton's "Smoky Mountain Christmas," after she's ingratiated herself to the orphans who've been squatting in her friend's cabin, and they're all sitting cozy, around a fire, stringing popcorn, eating Mountain Dan's fruitcake and singing Christmas songs? That's what Alexander Michael's feels like during the holidays. Pure country charm, cheer and delicious food! I visited here last year and am planning to stop in again this year for the holidays - it just feels like down home family dinner (with a functional family, not your dysfunctional one).

Warm welcome & quick bar stool seat. Spicy tasty veggie burger & good fresh broccoli slaw. Beer selection good tried light Node lager. Great find while searching neighborhoods to visit. Crowded a little loud but upbeat & friendly.

This is a cool spot where you can get good food and good drinks! the atmosphere is nice, perfect for drinking after 5pm. !!! 
Service is friendly, it is just a good hidden diamond outskirts of the city.
We can't wait to go back, next time no kids, although they had hamburgers for the kids it really isn't a spot for kids.
Nachos are amazing! Try them original or with chicken. 'What it is' is also great. Everything we tried was awesome so you can't go wrong.

This is definitely one of the few bars in the uptown (ish) area that doesn't feel like some sort of corporate cookie cutter joint. Combine that with good (german!) beer and you've got a real winner. 

They food isn't going to blow your mind per se but it's pretty good. Their fried pickles are among the best and the "what it is" chicken dish is hearty and satisfying.

Solid comfort food/beer joint.

My first impression was what a cute neighborhood! The historic and charming homes are such a treat in a city where everything seems brand new. 

Upon entering this pub-like restaurant/bar we were seated and greeted promptly. 

I ordered a cider on tap (a favorite of mine), a side salad, and the "What it is" . The star oddly enough was the salad, she said all their dressings were homemade and it certainly tasted that way.  The "What it is" was just ok in my opinion. I have had my share of amazing pasta dishes but never have been much of a rotini fan. The dish has a lot of dried herbs and I just prefer fresh...the chicken seemed almost too rubbed in cajun spice for my taste. That being said, I would like to give it another shot and order something else besides pasta ..I really am a tough critic in the Italian department. 

My biggest gripe of the night was the pace of service. I don't know if the server (or chef) had somewhere to be but she was going a mile a minute. I wanted to relax and enjoy my meal not be rushed in and out in less than 45minutes. My dinner came as half of my salad remained uneaten...and the salad was literally brought out in less than a minute after I ordered it. I realize its a small venue with limited seating but there wasn't anyone waiting for a table and last  I checked this was not at a fast food joint.

I've been here a couple times now and every experience has been great, whether stopping by for lunch or dinner. It's definitely a gem in 4th Ward and worth stopping in if you're in the area.

My latest stop into Alexander Michael's was to continue my quest around Charlotte to find the best reuben in the city. The classic sandwich didn't disappoint. The corned beef was OK, a little above average, and the kraut was your standard store-bought style. It was loaded up with flavorful cheese and russian, adding an unhealthy but delicious flavor. Where the reuben really stood out though was the bread - it was full of that great rye flavor you're looking for and crisped up perfectly. Additionaly, the ingredients were proportioned perfectly - something I've rarely found on my journey. When it all came together it was one of the better reubens I've tried of the approximately 30 so far. It's definitely a place I plan to head back to so I can enjoy another delicious reuben from this great establishment.

So glad we decided to check out this hidden gem. It's in an old house on 9th street in a quiet neighborhood. Inside is 80's pub and looks like they haven't changed much. Loved it. We grabbed the last available table and had great service. There were several couples out for a date night and groups of friends. Great, cozy vibe. 

Good beer selection. We were feeling like splitting a couple apps instead of ordering meals. Wings were good but nothing special. I liked the black bean hummus. Nachos were great. Flour chips instead of corn-- which by boyfriend really loved. Lots of toppings! 

So many of their entrees and pasta dishes looked good, can't wait to go back and try one!

Al Mike's is my favorite neighborhood bar in Charlotte, NC.  The only problem with it is that its too far away from my house!  :)  It is a treat to visit the 4th ward.  Great food, drinks, and company!
Decent place. The food was good. They have some good choices on their lunch menu, and a great local beer selection. I ordered the Reuben and the Cajun Fries. I liked the Cajun Fries a lot.

Perfect hole in the wall, true pub. The half pound burger is maybe the best I've ever had and the selection of local brews is the perfect compliment. If you are a local looking for a "regular spot," or a tourist looking for that "place only the locals know about," Al Mike's is it!

5 star experience.

Old school barman know what their talking about and give the place a quality but welcoming feel.

Music went from the lesser know beatles songs to Dylan.

Food was fantastic, I had the kind broil + an additional side of the slaw which was not too wet. Carrot cake was moist and fresh and a definite must. 

Finally, beer selection was spesh, no just picking beers at random gimmicks here, good selection of hard to find ales. 

Definitely coming back

Feels like home! The place is small, but it feels so cozy and warm. They don't take reservations, but the wait is never a problem because you can sit at the bar and enjoy some local craft beers. We had the "what it is" and the "honey chicken" and loved both. The staff is nice and attentive and makes you feel like a local the second you walk in. Will definitely be going back!
The bartender was excellent and a great local bar with good beer selection, but it was listed as creole food and it has none.  Crab soup with imitation crab. Left and went to kings kitchen.

Alexander Michael's is the quintessential go-to spot for solid food, good drinks and superb company all packaged into a quaint little spot in the 4th ward. 

Hubs and I used to frequent this sweet little spot fairly often when we lived Uptown. It's the perfect locale for a delicious burger or even better, in my opinion, an amazing chicken pita. I've tried a handful of different things at this stop, but I always go back to the pita. Plenty of moist, well seasoned bird stuffed into a fluffy, mouth watering pita, special sauce, cheese and lettuce and tomato. If I'm feeling all healthy schmealthy I go for a side salad or fruit, but their onion rings are pretty tasty too!

The service has always been super friendly and laid back - just how I like it at this kind of joint. Next time my tummy's growling in the 4th ward I'll definitely make a trip back to Alexander Michael's!
Never disappoints! Entrees are $15-20 but I come for the sandwiches. They can't be beat for $8-11.

Need a good, unique date spot? Here's the place. Great little hidden gem in uptown's historic 4th Ward neighborhood.

Food: First things first... whatever meal you get make sure to get a cup or bowl of the spicy crab soup. Money. Not so hungry or just want a snack? The fried pickles are spot on. The London Broil is just fantastic. The marinade they use on it is super delicious. Dinner version comes sliced up in entree form... lunch as a sandwich. You get a side item with both.

Bar: They have a good selection of local beers. If the restaurant is busy and you can't get a table... sit here. The service is always top notch.

Parking: there is a lot less than a block from the restaurant between Graham and Pine. There seems to be a lot of confusion surrounding parking here. I think a lot of it is because the signs are kind of confusing. You can park there for two hours without a parking permit. Bonus: had too much to drink and need to take a cab? The A Mike's staff will you show you where you can park your car overnight.

I love to bring out of town guests here. Such a charming place in a great neighborhood. Warm, welcoming, homey atmosphere.
Such a great low key place to go and have a great dinner. Their Fried pickles are amazing and have an awesome beer selection! This is my go to place for a fun relaxing evening dinner uptown.
I liked the place.  Food is definitely bar food, but great atmosphere.  Warm, inviting, wood everywhere, nice folks.

We sat at the bar Saturday night for a few drinks and dinner. The bar was not full. We got our drinks and asked if we could order our dinner when she got a chance. We waited 20 minutes and asked the same question. The bartender rolled her eyes and said, "when I get a chance". The food was acceptable, not great, and the service was crappy at best.

I recently moved to the Uptown area and have been frantically trying to experience every bar and restaurant the city has to offer to find my "go-to" joint. We were "tipped off" by a fellow Charlottinian about Alexander Michael's, and were intrigued by the directions he gave us to get there. "You're not far from it. Off the beaten path. Shortcut through the shrubs." I already liked it. 

Once we found the shortcut, we immediately smelled the food and followed our noses. It is tucked away in a residential area and if the food didn't smell so good you might walk right by it. We sat at the bar and needed to pull the candle closer in order to read the menu. If you take anything from this review let it be this: Honey. Garlic. BBQ Wings. YUM.

I ordered the veggie burger as my main and was expecting nothing exciting, since most restaurants serve the usual warm-on-the-outside-cold-in-the-middle-sad-excuse-for-a-meal hockey puck. I was surprised that it was not only excellent and flavorful, but clearly home made. They had a great selection of micro-brewed beers in addition to the usual suspects, so my fiancee was happy from the moment we sat down. Laid back, fun and low-key, we definitely found our go-to joint. Oh, and ladies, watch out for the pole in the bathroom. You'll thank me later.

I've never waited long at Alexander Michaels, which has always been nice. The ambiance is friendly and very casual which makes spending time with others there relaxing and fun. The 4th Ward location offers an escape from the city, without having to leave the city. 

The food is not something that I've ever felt was out-of-this-world, but it definitely is good. A lot of friends have loved their selection, but I just may not have made the right entree selections.

Regardless, I'm looking forward to my next trip back to Al Mike's
Very nice place.  On the edge of uptown, but it doesn't really have an uptown feel.  Very cozy atmosphere and great food.

Al Mike's looks like a house that turned their 1st floor into a bar. The atmosphere is really chill, and they have good cheap beers on tap and serve typical bar food. There was plenty of street parking when I went. 

My fave part of Al Mikes is that it's a very non-uptowny bar in uptown, check it out!

Btw, what is with people and fried pickles?!

I liked the drinks and dessert. The garden salad was only adequate, the London broil was difficult to finish as vinegar overwhelmed the taste, and the bread was unbelievably dreadful. The service was excellent as well as the vibe.

Oh. My. Gosh. Amazing. Came here after a 9 hour drive from Tampa for a little birthday dinner and my lanta it surpassed honestly anything I could've imagined. The London broil was to die for. My boyfriend got the hamburger and baked potato which were also delicious! I would probably come back to charlotte just for that London broil alone though! The character of the place was great! It was totally unexpected with all different kinds of people from 20 something's to families to older couples. Large selection of alcoholic drinks and very friendly staff! Definitely would recommend again and again and again

This place is a GEM!  A nice relaxing neighborhood restaurant.  

The London Broil sandwich is awesome!  The crab soup is Awesome!  

I got a turkey sandwich that was on special once and it was just OK.  

I believe the owner works there everyday.  Good staff.  I can't wait to go back.  

One of my favorites.

A down home family restaurant and bar .... Irish style... I feel like I'm home ! Great food, great service.

If you like the warmth of dark wood paneling, old style bars and that kind of special feeling some real Irish pubs have (in Ireland I mean) then this place is for you. The setting just enhances the cozy menu with its homey grilled cheese and chili, London broil sandwich and the lightest onion rings I've ever had.

It's even a family run business and if you're lucky, you might even meet the younger family members helping out some afternoon like we did ... Made the day even more special!

Always, always great food!  Then, you have consistently great service.  This is a wonderful, cozy tavern serving delicious comfort food.  I always try something different and am always pleased with my order.  Tonight we enjoyed fried pickles, catfish and grilled buffalo chicken.  Looking forward to my next visit!

I really enjoyed this place!  The place was hopping on a Thursday afternoon for lunch and we were lucky to snag a spot at the bar.  The bartenders were very friendly and on the money with getting us beers and taking our orders.  We both had the london broil sandwich (medium rare, yo!) and I had the side of fries.

The fries.

New winners, folks, of best fries in the world.  I will make the 3 hour drive for those fries, any day.

Capitalizing LOVE doesn't do Al Mike's justice. I moved to Fourth Ward in 2014 after being in Charlotte for six years. I bought a place off South Blvd. in 2016 and one of the very few things (only, maybe) I miss about Fourth Ward is Al Mike's. They are great for a sit-down dinner in a wooden booth that screams old school privacy. At the same time, the bar is inviting to hang out with your neighbors over a pint or mixed drink at a good price.

The staff is the best in Uptown and as good as you'll find in the city. Tucked into the base of the old neighborhood market, this is a true treasure of Charlotte.

I been there twice, and was worried that the second time would be a let down. Not so - I love this bar. The best part: it's walkable from my place, most of the clientele was born in the 70's, they sell my favorite beer (Duvel), and have a greek-themed menu. Pretty much perfection for me.

Impeccable service! Hostess/waitress was amazing! She was very accommodating and knowledgeable of the area. Food was good but not exceptional. I had the London broil sandwich which they are famous for and the meet was very tender. The atmosphere was exceptional! I would recommend as a great place to stop for a snack and a quick drink or a social hour or two with some of the friendliest staff and best beer in the downtown Charlotte area.

I have visited Charlotte many times but had not been to the restaurant before last weekend. This is the perfect place to go for good food, beer and atmosphere.

Its a real gem, tucked away but worth looking for and is firmly on my list of favorites in Charlotte.

If I lived in Charlotte I would be a regular.

I came here on a Tuesday night and business was booming!  Yay!  I am absolutely in love with the neighborhood that holds this little gem.  It is especially nice all decorated for Christmas.  The restaurant is so cozy and warm.  I love the feeling when I walked in.  I felt right at home.  I was so happy with everything about the atmosphere.  Parking is a little tricky, as there is no lot, but only street parking. 

The place lived up to it's reviews.  I was happy with the service and the food was amazing.  The had drink specials, but I choose a glass of red wine to warm me up.  It was perfect!  The waitress was friendly and attentive.  I had the crab soup to start-yum!!!  I ordered the beef stroganoff for my main dish and it was an exceptional choice.   I opted for fettuccini noodles instead of rotini.  The waitress actually forgot and remembered right when she gave it to me (not a big deal), but she insisted on taking it back and fixing it.  She was so nice, she even brought me extra wine on the house for waiting. 

I really enjoyed this place and I can not wait to get back here and try more.

This is one of my locals and they have their staple dishes. The location is great surrounded by historical homes all with a story. This is a good stop for a different feel on the way for an uptown adventure. Food is not the greatest however the overall ambience will sell you and keep you coming back. This is a must do in clt.

(repost - since I'd originally had this under Andrew Blair's, and I confuse two-named things constantly)

Weird. I feel like I ate at a totally different place than every other reviewer. Maybe ABs gets flustered when they try to put on their fancy-pants for Restaurant Week.

Yeah, it's a little faux-pub, a little fratty, but there are only two TVs (god, my standards are dropping) and the food is cheap. What did I get? The nachos. What will I probably get every time I come? Said nachos. No art, no pretention - fried flour tortillas dusted with something aromatic and carefully smothered with black beans, cheese, tomatoes, and (tehehe) lettuce shreds we'll just go ahead and call chiffonade. Simple, textural, good. For 7 bucks. Jalapenos needed, my spicy friends, so ask. The size of your head, this pile, no, torso.

It's 1994 up in this joint, and they don't give a damn - but it limits the veg selections. I can respect the beer list, and the service was quietly good. Darkish lighting. I had a feeling in the pit of my stomach underneath the 5 pounds of nacho that the place swims in RL polos and Sperrys on the wkends (and this is before I perused other yelper's thoughts on the subject) but for Monday night nosh, it competently hit the spot.

I came in during a very busy time last night and the staff greeted me and my guest at the door with a smile. We were shown to a "half booth" in the back with the option to wait for a real table, but we found it quite cozy. 

We began with the nachos which were delicious. The soft chips are a nice spin on classic nachos. I had the "What it is" which is said to be a favorite on the menu. It is basically a Cajun chicken pasta. It was very good, a tad salty but good. My guest ordered the honey chicken pasta with the tomato bacon sauce which she enjoyed. The helpings were very generous. 

Our service was great the whole time we were there. We were in a back corner on a busy night and we never went long with something we needed. We thought the prices were quite fair for the food. 

I loved the neighborhood feel of the place, it reminded me of a big city back street restaurant. I would definitely go back.

We went here for a Saturday lunch.  The place is really cute, tucked in the heart of the fourth ward.  The inside had great old retro decor and art. The menu was good for pub food, great sandwiches and apps.  The salads were ok, nothing special.  My Reuben was delicious, as well as the onion rings. My boyfriend got the chicken sandwich, blackened on a pita, and it was outstanding. He wanted to order a second one! The chicken wings appetizer was also delicious. They were meaty wings and cooked well with delicious sauce.  The only drawback is that the menu lacks healthy options.  Everything comes on bread or with a side of fried items.  As long as you are ok with eating not so healthy food (I mean it is a pub...) then it's fantastic! I would like to try the dinner menu, and BF wants to go back for that sandwich ASAP!

Such a solid restaurant, and a quaint local spot all rolled into one. You really can't go wrong with a trip to Alexander Michael's (aka Al Mike's). The food here is prepared fresh and is simply delicious, and there's something for everyone on the menu. 

We stopped in for lunch today, and made it in a little before the typical lunch rush. I went with their three cheese melt and a cup of their spicy crab soup. It was perfect for a chilly December day in Charlotte. Do not be alarmed by the "spicy" in their crab soup, it really is more a subtle heat, and I am one that is a wuss when it comes to spicy foods, and I gobbled it up! It really is a very mild spice that just warms you up right along with the rest of the soup. The chunks of crab in here let you know the soup is the real deal too! Simply delicious! 

My husband went with the burger and pasta salad. I had a little bit of plate envy when I saw the size of the burger, and totally stole some pasta salad. Ask your server for some of their house vinegrette to put on the pasta salad, if they don't bring it out already. It's good!

We went there on a Friday night and the place was packed.  Staff greeted us immediately and sat us quickly.  Food was great.  We shared the fried pickles and had the crawfish burrito and the "what is it".  I can't stress enough on how excellent the services was.  For as crowded as they were it was quite amazing we were treated like royalty!

Can't get enough of their crab soup! It's so good I buy it by the half gallon and take it home. Their burgers are the only other thing I've tried, which are also amazing. Really great atmosphere for a date, girls night or even lunch. You'll also love the staff!

Had a great time at Al Miike's this week. The Food was greatl The locals and the staff or great for company. The bartender suggested Today's Special, meatloaf, mash, and gravy. Awesome comfort food to go along with the warm welcoming locally owned and managed bar and restaurant. If you haven't been to Al Mikes, you are truly missing out on an amazing all around warm neighborhood tavern experience. Charlotte's version of Cheers... where you can feel like, "everybody knows your name."

Great food, great atmosphere in that cozy neighborhood pub where you feel like you belong. The restaurant was in full swing, and the owner took care of our table to make sure service standards were met. The "what it is" is phenomenal, and they offer a fantastic selection of local beers. Will definitely be back, thanks for making us feel like family!

This is a cute small pub with pretty good food. Tucked away within the 4th Ward neighborhood this restaurant has soul. I went on a Saturday night and it was crowded yet we didn't wait for a table longer than ten minutes. I had the Jerk Chicken Quesadilla and potato wedges which were delicious. The customer service really is what sets the bar high as everyone was nice and attentive. I will definitely visit again. #yum

Back in Aug when I was out in Charlotte a co -worker took me to Alexander Michael's.  This place is a cute neighborhood gem.  I loved it!  It's removed from the main uptown area of Charlotte and it seems like this is the place where locals go.

My dinner was awesome.  I ordered their blackend cat fish sandwich with fried pickles.  Yum!  Since, fried pickles don't exist in CA, I loved eating them while I was out in Charlotte.  If I'm ever back in Charlotte, I would eat at this place again.   ;o)

I've been coming here for years and I love the history of the building, the friendliness of the employees and the overall experience. This is a great date spot because of the ambiance and energy (also you can stroll through the nearby park after dinner). I feel like there are two groups of people - those who don't know about Al Mikes and those who love it (and hope the others don't ever try it so that the wait times don't get too outrageous). I am in the group that love it!

First of all, every employee is welcoming and friendly. The owner/manager (I'm not sure) clearly loves the place and the people. He is the host, he brings out the food, he buses tables, he checks in with guests, etc. I love the way he takes pride in making sure every customer has a great experience. I consistently get the "What It Is". The flavor is great and the portion size always allows for sharing and having leftovers the next day. My boyfriend samples different things on the menu but loves the beef stroganoff. He tried the london broil (kinda dry) and the wings (could've been a little more crispy) but says the beef stroganoff is the best thing he has tried. Friends say their veggie burger is awesome, but I haven't tried it. 

Parking can be tricky but we don't mind walking a little bit if needed, so it isn't a problem. There is usually a wait but it's worth it. Overall this is a great spot.

This is one of my favorite spots in charlotte- the food is consistently delicious and the atmosphere is laid back with a friendly, neighborhood vibe. The menu is fairly small but has a little bit of everything: classic bar appetizers, pasta dishes, burgers and sandwiches. They also have a decent selection of local beers on draft.

I usually always get one of the pasta dishes like the honey chicken or the what it is. Last night I opted for the penne Athena and it was delicious! The cream sauce was flavorful but still very light and the veggies were fresh and delicious. As a starter I highly recommend the crab soup- it's so good, I could honestly make a meal out of just that!

Another thing I really love about Al Mike's is that all of their chicken is natural and raised without antibiotics which is a surprising touch for a tavern-style restaurant, but it is very much appreciated!

Came in to Charlotte on business and saw this getting consistently good reviews on Trip Advisor...

So glad I stopped in! This place is overflowing with charm and character, and their drink selection is 

The waitress recommended the NoDa IPA and I'm so glad she did! So hoppy and bold; paired really well with the blackened fish I got and the crab soup, which is as good as everyone says it is!

Blackened fish was *a hair* salty for me, but I've been watching a lot of chopped so maybe I'm being judgy. Went great with some beer tho!

FYI the cook on the fish was phenomenal; as someone living in DFW I appreciate good fish when I can get it! TBH I would be just find having the NoDa IPA and the crab soup by itself though, both very comforting and filling. Yum!

All in all, everything was on point and I had a fantastic experience; I look forward to coming back!

My husband and I went for lunch here and we loved it! It's located in a great location uptown and the service was great! My husband enjoyed the wings and I had a fantastic sandwich! Can't wait to go back and experience during dinner.

Came here for lunch w/ some coworkers. Was surprisingly quiet. Had the jerk chicken salad special, was delicious, didn't need salad dressing. Service was incredible, even called a cab for my colleagues who needed to get to the airport. Down to earth, casual, would probably be one of my go-to places if I were a local.

Very good food. Nice atmosphere. Good variety of food to choose from. Well priced. We had a group of 6 and they had no problem seating us and getting us food in a timely manner. We will come back next time we are in the area

The best meal we had in a long time.  Beautiful old decor, excellent and fast service, and delicious food.  A restaurant with an intelligent sense of humor: read the back cover of the menu, talk to the staff, and you shall see.  The portions are generous, and soft drinks and teas get refilled without having to ask.  Crab soup, nachos, fries, onion rings, chicken dishes, and the London Broil were all perfect.  They had a good selection of beer and wine, all available by glass, but had to drive, so could not try.  The prices are moderate, which makes this place an excellent value, which I would definitely recommend to a friend.
Excellent service from an incredibly friendly staff. However, the food was just okay.

Alexander Michael's is one of my favorite places to go in Charlotte.  The aesthetic feel is very homey, and the service is excellent.  I have never been disappointed with anything I have ordered Alexander Michael's.  I would recommend the pasta dishes, burgers, london broil sandwich, wings, and jerk chicken quesadillas.  The pricing is very reasonable as well.  Do yourself a favor and dine at Alexander Michael's.
Local's spot for folks that live uptown. Old school and excellent. If you don't like this place then "Fuck You!" Period. They don't need you.

My husband and I just love Al Mikes and the staff. Steve is always there working hard. Paul is one of our favorite bar tenders in Charlotte. Not too many pescetarian options which is my only downfall but the food is delicious with amazing craft beer choices! Get the nachos you won't be disappointed.
The most amazing hidden gem. Delicious food and incredible atmosphere. Favorite place to go for a drink or dinner in Charlotte.

There's something about the simplicity of this place, and the friendliness of the staff, that keeps bringing me back here. Since I've moved to Charlotte, I've tried the fried  pickles at almost every restaurant I've been to, and I have to say.. the ones at Alexander Michael's are among the top three in this city! The food is simple and tasty (even if you just want a simple garden burger, Cajun fried & a blue moon!) The atmosphere is cozy and unpretentious. It's a great place to visit even on a Monday evening!

Shh.
The first rule of Alexander Michael's is: you do not talk about Alexander Michael's.
The second rule of Alexander Michael's is: you DO NOT talk about Alexander Michael's.
The third rule is to not run into the pole in the woman's bathroom and don't go upstairs because it's haunted. But that's for another review.

You would miss this place if you were strolling through 4th ward looking at the houses, because it fits right in. Located in an older house, the ambiance is casual but dark. Food style: It's an amalgamation of Cajun and American, nothing too off the wall. But it's all delicious.
